channel.title: Unhappy americans
channel.description:
This is just a message going around MySpace, but i thought i would post it here to see what others had to say about it.
The other day I was reading Newsweek magazine and came across some Poll data I found rather hard to believe. It must be true given the source, right? The Newsweek poll alleges that 67 percent of Americans are unhappy with the direction the country is headed and 69 percent of the country is unhappy with the performance of the President. In essence 2/3 of the citizens just ain't happy and want a change. So I started thinking, What are we so unhappy about?
A. Is it that we have electricity and running water 24 hours a day, 7 Days a week?
B. Is our unhappiness the result of having air conditioning in the summer and heating in the winter?
C. Could it be that 95.4 percent of these unhappy folks have a job?
D. Maybe it is the ability to walk into a grocery store at any time and see more food in moments than Darfur has seen in the last year?
E. Maybe it is the ability to drive our cars and trucks from the Pacific Ocean to the Atlantic Ocean without having to present identification papers as we move through each state.
F. Or possibly the hundreds of clean and safe motels we would find along the way that can provide temporary shelter?
G. I guess having thousands of restaurants with varying cuisine from around the world is just not good enough either.
H. Or could it be that when we wreck our car, emergency workers show up and provide services to help all and even send a helicopter to take you to the hospital.
I. Perhaps you are one of the 70 percent of Americans who own a home.
J. You may be upset with knowing that in the unfortunate case of a fire, a group of trained firefighters will appear in moments and use top notch equipment to extinguish the flames thus saving you, your family, and your belongings.
K. Or if, while at home watching one of your many flat screen TVs, a burglar or prowler intrudes, an officer equipped with a gun and a bullet-proof vest will come to defend you and your family against attack or loss.
L. This all in the backdrop of a neighborhood free of bombs or militias raping and pillaging the residents. Neighborhoods where 90% of teenagers own cell phones and computers.
M. How about the complete religious, social and political freedoms we enjoy that are the envy of everyone in the world?
Maybe that is what has 67% of you folks unhappy.
Fact is, we are the largest group of ungrateful, spoiled brats the world has ever seen. No wonder the world loves the U.S., yet has a great disdain for its citizens. They see us for what we are. The most blessed people in the world who do nothing but complain about what we don't have, and what we hate about the country instead of thanking the good Lord we live here.
I know, I know. What about the president who took us into war and has no plan to get us out? The president who has a measly 31 percent approval rating? Is this the same president who guided the nation in the dark days after 9/11? The president that cut taxes to bring an economy out of recession? Could this be the same guy who has been called every name in the book for succeeding in keeping all the spoiled ungrateful brats safe from terrorist attacks? The commander in chief of an all-volunteer army that is out there defending you and me?
Did you hear how bad the President is on the news or talk show? Did this news affect you so much, make you so unhappy you couldn't take a look around for yourself and see all the good things and be glad? Think about it......are you upset at the President because he actually caused you personal pain OR is it because the 'Media' told you he was failing to kiss your sorry ungrateful behind every day.
Make no mistake about it. The troops in Iraq and Afghanistan have volunteered to serve, and in many cases may have died for your freedom. There is currently no draft in this country. They didn't have to go. They are able to refuse to go and end up with either a ''general'' discharge, an 'other than honorable'' discharge or, worst case scenario, a ''dishonorable' discharge after a few days in the brig.
So why then the flat-out discontentment in the minds of 69 percent of Americans?
Say what you want, but I blame it on the media. If it bleeds it leads and they specialize in bad news. Everybody will watch a car crash with blood and guts. How many will watch kids selling lemonade at the corner? The media knows this and media outlets are for-profit corporations. They offer what sells, and when criticized, try to defend their actions by 'justifying' them in one way or another. Just ask why they tried to allow a murderer like O.J. Simpson to write a book about how he didn't kill his wife, but if he did he would have done it this way......Insane!
Turn off the TV, burn Newsweek, and use the New York Times for the bottom of your bird cage. Then start being grateful for all we have as a country. There is exponentially more good than bad. We are among the most blessed people on Earth and should thank God several times a day, or at least be thankful and appreciative.' 'With hurricanes, tornados, fires out of control, mud slides, flooding, severe thunderstorms tearing up the country from one end to another, and with the threat of bird flu and terrorist attacks, 'Are we sure this is a good time to take God out of the Pledge of Allegiance?'

item.title: Unhappy americans
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:21, topic:236569”]America is not a real democracy. In a democratic country everyone has the right to vote and to be voted on. If PaulT wanted to be a president, he couldn’t because in America you have to be either Democratic or Republican. PaulT probably doesn’t agree with either of the two, but he can’t start his own party.

*PaulT is just being used as an example, I have no idea if he actually is like what I said.[/quote]

To continue on that, in a democratic country all party’s get the same amount of media attention. I must be blind, but I only see grandpa with his hot chick and nigger with his stephgrandfather on tv.

Read full topic

item.title: Unhappy americans
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:28, topic:236569”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=312226.msg2496685#msg2496685 date=1224437216]

The American election is based around money. The party which blows the most money on TV ads, billboards and makes TV appearances tends to win. The problem this year is they’re both blowing millions hence the intensity.

This is also the reason why you only have two real parties, no-one else has the finance available to compete.

A second reason is that the Americans only care about the image of the candidate, and not his actual plans.
[/quote]
they arent intelligent enough to even look at what the candidate wants to do in the future[/quote]
Dude fuck off. The educated people in America do vote, and normally the ones that don’t care don’t. But this year since theres a blacky in the house people HAVE to vote because they either want or don’t want a black president.

R.I.P RSC:

It’s the fact that you stopped using black slaves. They are the criminals now, and they are the ones that cost money.

In history we did trade slaves and paid for them. And we still are with our taxes paying for their food in jail. Black people think white people owe them something so they want ‘respect’. PFFT If they didnt have such an ignorant attitude and talk shit then maybe i would.

Read full topic

item.title: Unhappy americans
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“the fu superior, post:24, topic:236569”][quote author=Frell link=topic=312226.msg2489610#msg2489610 date=1224026593]

who gives a shit if they’re unhappy? they’re american they deserve it

We dont deserve shit. Maybe our government does, but no not us. There are some people out there that take advantage of our laws and totally screw everything up and give us a bad name. Many lazy people, but if you look at the business and the cities and shit, we aren’t really that dumb.

If you are unhappy, you brought it on yourself. EVERYONE in America has the opportunity to live the life they want, but some of them are lazy and think they can get away with not working. Then the suffer and blame everyone else.

But yes, i fucken hate CREAM
[/quote]
last time i checked. you choose who your government is.[/quote]

[quote=“Frell, post:15, topic:236569”][quote author=yakman link=topic=312226.msg2490514#msg2490514 date=1224094083]

Maybe our government does, but no not us.

and who put that government in power?
you did, because america is a democracy (supposedly) and you have only yourself to blame if the government is bad.
[/quote]
Very true, but they do not let us in on everything. IDK im here cuz i was pushed out here.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.description:

Thanks, Yeah, it was pretty rough. I did eventually meet my biological father in 2005 and i have a relationship with him. But my dad who raised me died in 2007 and it was really hard.
I’m not really a bro, but it’s all good!

item.title: Unhappy americans
item.dc:creator: @srt8 srt8
item.description:
@srt8 wrote:

When i talk about pushing through hard things, i mean things everyone goes through. Like when my Dad and brother died. Or when i finally discovered at 16 years old that my whole family had lied to me. That could happen to anyone and make them want to commit suicide. But i pushed through it, which is why i’m a stronger person today

Read full topic

item.title: Unhappy americans
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“srt8, post:11, topic:236569”][quote author=pk4pk link=topic=312226.msg2489859#msg2489859 date=1224035768]
We are all noobs. What can we say.
[/quote]
Agreed!

But still, just because we are Americans doesn’t mean we should be unhappy. I would think most of us are not unhappy. I’m very happy. I live in a country where I can attend college to better myself in the work force, i have a closet (okay 2 closets) filled with clothes, a fridge of food, and an apartment to live in. And above all, i have the greatest family in the world. Sure, we are all unhappy at sometime in our life, but it’s pushing through those times that makes you a stronger, happier person[/quote]pushing through the things Americans complain about is nothing compared to what other countries have to push through to be happy.

Read full topic
